chapter.title: Database Service Management command-line client
chapter.para: The trove-manage client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the Database Management Utility and its extensions. This chapter documents trove-manage version 2014.2.
For help on a specific trove-manage command, enter:

screen.computeroutput:
usage: trove-manage [-h] [--config-dir DIR] [--config-file PATH] [--debug] [--log-config-append PATH] [--log-date-format DATE_FORMAT] [--log-dir LOG_DIR] [--log-file PATH] [--log-format FORMAT] [--nodebug] [--nouse-syslog] [--nouse-syslog-rfc-format] [--noverbose] [--syslog-log-facility SYSLOG_LOG_FACILITY] [--use-syslog] [--use-syslog-rfc-format] [--verbose] [--version]
{db_sync,db_upgrade,db_downgrade,datastore_update,datastore_version_update,db_recreate} ...

listitem.para: show this help message and exit

Path to a config directory to pull *.conf files from. This file set is sorted, so as to provide a predictable parse order if individual options are over-ridden. The set is parsed after the file(s) specified via previous --config-file, arguments hence over-ridden options in the directory take precedence.
Path to a config file to use. Multiple config files can be specified, with values in later files taking precedence. The default files used are: None.
Print debugging output (set logging level to DEBUG instead of default WARNING level).

The name of a logging configuration file. This file is appended to any existing logging configuration files. For details about logging configuration files, see the Python logging module documentation.
Format string for %(asctime)s in log records. Default: None .
(Optional) The base directory used for relative --log- file paths.
(Optional) Name of log file to output to. If no default is set, logging will go to stdout.

DEPRECATED. A logging.Formatter log message format string which may use any of the available logging.LogRecord attributes. This option is deprecated. Please use logging_context_format_string and logging_default_format_string instead.
The inverse of --debug
The inverse of --use-syslog
The inverse of --use-syslog-rfc-format
The inverse of --verbose
Syslog facility to receive log lines.
Use syslog for logging. Existing syslog format is DEPRECATED during I, and will change in J to honor RFC5424.

(Optional) Enables or disables syslog rfc5424 format for logging. If enabled, prefixes the MSG part of the syslog message with APP-NAME (RFC5424). The format without the APP-NAME is deprecated in I, and will be removed in J.
Print more verbose output (set logging level to INFO instead of default WARNING level).
show program's version number and exit

section.title: trove-manage datastore_update command
section.para: Add or update a datastore. If the datastore already exists, the default version will be updated.

listitem.para: Name of the datastore.
Name or ID of an existing datastore version to set as the default. When adding a new datastore, use an empty string.
show this help message and exit

section.title: trove-manage datastore_version_update command

screen.computeroutput: usage: trove-manage datastore_version_update [-h] datastore version_name manager image_id packages active

section.para: Add or update a datastore version. If the datastore version already exists, all values except the datastore name and version will be updated.

listitem.para: Name of the datastore.
Name of the datastore version.
Name of the manager that will administer the datastore version.
ID of the image used to create an instance of the datastore version.
Packages required by the datastore version that are installed on the guest image.
Whether the datastore version is active or not. Accepted values are 0 and 1.
show this help message and exit

section.title: trove-manage db_downgrade command
section.para: Downgrade the database to the specified version.

listitem.para: Target version.
show this help message and exit
SQLAlchemy Migrate repository path.

section.title: trove-manage db_recreate command
section.para: Drop the database and recreate it.

listitem.para: SQLAlchemy Migrate repository path.
show this help message and exit
show this help message and exit
SQLAlchemy Migrate repository path.

section.title: trove-manage db_upgrade command
section.para: Upgrade the database to the specified version.

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
Target version. Defaults to the latest version.
SQLAlchemy Migrate repository path.
